 091:                  np.ndarray[DTYPE_t, ndim=2] segments,
 092:                  float contig_length,
 093:                  float mu,
 094:                  float sigma,
 095:                  float max_insertion=100,
 096:                  float min_aln=20,
 097:                  float max_homology=100,
 098:                  float ins_cost=1,
 099:                  float hom_cost=3,
 100:                  float inter_cost=2,
 101:                  float U=9,
 102:                  float match_score=1):
 103:     """
 104:     The scoring has become quite complicated.
 105:      = Last alignment score - jump cost
 106: 
 107:     where each jump has a cost:
 108:     jump cost = S + microhomology_length + insertion_length        # S = 10 for intra, 20 for inter
 109: 
 110:     The last score takes into account mismatched and gaps
 111: 
 112:     :param mapped:  The input dataframe with candidate alignments
 113:     :param contig_length:   Length of the contig
 114:     :param max_insertion: Arbitrary high number
 115:     :param min_aln: The minimum sequence which is not part of a microhomology overlap
 116:     :param max_homology: Arbitrary high number
 117:     :return: A dataframe with the inferred alignments
 118:     """
 119: 
 120:     # Start at first node then start another loop running backwards through the preceeding nodes.
 121:     # Choose the best score out of the in edges.
 122:     # Use a special start and end node to score the first and last alignments
 123: 
+124:     cdef np.ndarray[np.int_t, ndim=1] pred = np.zeros(segments.shape[0], dtype=np.int)
  __pyx_t_1 = __Pyx_GetModuleGlobalName(__pyx_n_s_np); if (unlikely(!__pyx_t_1)) __PYX_ERR(0, 124, __pyx_L1_error)
  __Pyx_GOTREF(__pyx_t_1);
  __pyx_t_2 = __Pyx_PyObject_GetAttrStr(__pyx_t_1, __pyx_n_s_zeros); if (unlikely(!__pyx_t_2)) __PYX_ERR(0, 124, __pyx_L1_error)
